author: Special Correspondent
text:
Although reports of chemical and forensic analysis of the viscera of the Thane mass murders are yet to arrive, the position of the bodies and blood splatter patterns at the scene of the crime have led police officials to believe that the victims were definitely sedated and not killed while they were naturally asleep.

Officials who visited the Warekar residence, where accused Hasnain Warekar allegedly killed his entire family before killing himself, told The Hindu that the victims appeared to have dozed off while talking among themselves, and didn’t look as if they had retired for the day. Blood splatter patterns on the walls also indicate the same, said sources. The police believe that had they retired for the day, eight members of a family would not have been sleeping in a single room when there was enough space.

Further, officials said, blood splatter on the walls was not more than a foot in height, and was spread in various directions.
title: ‘Victims were most certainly drugged’
